title: Accidental gunshot incident investigated
content:
Police are investigating an incident involving a man who accidentally shot himself Sunday.
At 1:34 p.m. Sunday, police received a 911 call about a man who had been shot in the 17000 block of North Bank Road in Roseburg.
When Douglas County Sheriff’s Office deputies arrived they found Michael Hill, 64, of Roseburg with an apparent gunshot wound to his left forearm. Hill was transported by ambulance to Mercy Medical Center. He was later transferred to Sacred Heart Hospital at RiverBend to receive a higher level of care for his injuries.
An investigation revealed Hill was looking at the firearm when it discharged. He then dropped the firearm, which discharged a second time as it hit the ground. That second shot caused the injury to his forearm.
Police said no criminal charges are expected.
